page.title: 05LANDSCAPE Boundaries
page.content: Contained within the four by three kilometre block are sections of the parishes of Asgarby and Howell, Heckington, Great Hale, Little Hale, and Burton Pedwardine.In the main however the parishes of Heckington and Great Hale comprise the majority of the area and these villages and the hamlet of Little Hale mark the boundary of the reclaimed fen land and the north to south route along its westernmost edge.This boundary is also marked by the ancient Roman canal known for most of its length as the Car Dyke which extends north towards the Humber estuary and south into Cambridgeshire. The line of the canal is marked by some modern roads and ditches , Roman pottery and tiles etc. are regularly unearthed during the everyday agricultural processes.
